qas.question: What year was the Cambridge Agreement signed?
America's first public school was founded in Boston in what year?
How many french and Indian wars did Boston participate in?
Who led the signing of the Cambridge Agreement?

context: In <a0_0>1629<a0_0/>, the Massachusetts Bay Colony's first governor, <a2_0><a4_0>John Winthrop<a4_0/><a2_0/>, led the signing of the Cambridge Agreement, a key founding document of the city. Puritan ethics and their focus on education influenced its early history; America's first public school was founded in Boston in <a1_0>1635<a1_0/>. Over the next 130 years, the city participated in <a3_0>four<a3_0/> French and Indian Wars, until the British defeated the French and their native allies in North America. Boston was the largest town in British North America until Philadelphia grew larger in the mid 18th century.
